channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Israel says CCTV footage shows hostages were taken to Gaza hospital
item.description: Israel says the video - which the BBC has not verified - shows captives were taken to al-Shifa on 7 October.

item.title: Evacuated premature babies arrive in southern Gaza
item.description: The babies were moved from al-Shifa hospital to receive urgent care in a neonatal intensive care unit.

item.title: ‘I paid £30k to protect my child from her paedophile dad’
item.description: The BBC follows a mother battling to keep a dangerous sex offender away from her daughter.

item.title: Far-right outsider Milei wins Argentina presidential run-off election
item.description: Ex-US President Donald Trump congratulates Javier Milei, saying he will "Make Argentina Great Again".

item.title: Ofsted 'seen as toxic' and schools should 'self-evaluate' instead, says inquiry
item.description: A report says Ofsted is seen as "toxic" and inspectors should not have direct contact with schools.

item.title: I'm A Celebrity 2023: Nigel Farage promises to show viewers 'the real me'
item.description: The former Ukip and Brexit Party leader is earning £1.5m to appear on this year's show.

item.title: Former OpenAI boss Sam Altman pictured at firm's HQ amid reports of return
item.description: Sam Altman posts a selfie from the firm's US head office 48 hours after his shock ouster from the company.

item.title: Russell Brand quizzed by Met Police over sex offence allegations
item.description: Comedian Russell Brand has been questioned by the Met Police over three allegations of historical sex offences

item.title: ‘I was addicted to social media - now I'm suing Big Tech’
item.description: The lawsuit says four of the largest social media firms knowingly expose children to harmful products.

item.title: US ex-President Jimmy Carter's wife Rosalynn dies aged 96
item.description: The Carter Center says the wife of ex-President Jimmy Carter died peacefully with her family by her side.

item.title: Extreme weather 'biggest threat' to UK heritage
item.description: The National Trust says climate change-linked extreme weather is now the biggest threat to its sites.

item.title: British actor and White Mischief star Joss Ackland dies aged 95
item.description: The stage and screen actor appeared in films including White Mischief and 1989's Lethal Weapon 2.

item.title: Student with rare disease to stay in UK after immigration battle
item.description: The Home Office grants an Egyptian national leave to remain due to lack of treatment in his home country.

item.title: The Papers: Tax cuts talk continues and hope of Israeli hostage deal
item.description: Jeremy Hunt hints there will be tax cuts but the papers are split in their assessment of what they will be.

item.title: How much money does the UK government raise and spend each year?
item.description: A breakdown of where the government's money comes from and where it goes.

item.title: Is it time for America's elder statesmen to retire?
item.description: President Joe Biden is turning 81. But he's far from America's only elderly politician.

item.title: Roblox: How one student became a big name in virtual fashion
item.description: Nineteen-year old Muneeb's in-game Roblox experience has been visited more than 1.6bn times

item.title: Napoleon's Ridley Scott on critics and cinema 'bum ache'
item.description: The director says his response to criticism from historians about his film would "have a bleep in it".

item.title: Time: Short prison sentence 'derailed' woman's life
item.description: As the BBC drama Time explores how brief jail terms can affect lives, one former inmate tells her story.

item.title: Ukraine war: The Russians snitching on colleagues and strangers
item.description: In Soviet Russia it was common for people to report others to the authorities - now the practice is back.

item.title: Don Walsh: The man who made the deepest ever dive
item.description: The remarkable story of Captain Don Walsh and his 11km journey to the bottom of the Mariana Trench.

item.title: What is income tax and how much will I pay?
item.description: New tax rules mean the amount of money raised by the government is rising significantly.

item.title: Art and class: Working-class artists on breaking into exclusive world
item.description: Artist Nathan Wyburn attributes his success to social media, bypassing the art world's gatekeepers.

item.title: Taylor Swift appears out of breath at Rio concert
item.description: Video showed the singer gasping for air in between songs during her performance in the stifling heat.

item.title: Pobol y Cwm TV actress: I was sexually assaulted as a child
item.description: Soap star Sera Cracroft says she has now chosen to share her story in order to help others.

item.title: Autumn Statement: Hunt does not rule out income tax cuts
item.description: The chancellor says he wants to lower taxes but only in a responsible way that does not risk inflation.

item.title: Watch: Crane falls from top of high rise in the Philippines after quake
item.description: The crane fell from the top of the construction site in Davao City in the Philippines.

item.title: Cornwall shaken by 2.7 magnitude earthquake
item.description: The tremor was felt by people across west Cornwall, who say it was like thunder or an avalanche.

item.title: Glastonbury 2024 tickets sell out in under an hour
item.description: Those who missed out will now have to wait for re-sale dates for the world-famous festival.

item.title: Barton House residents cannot return 'for two to three weeks'
item.description: Further "complex and intrusive" surveys are needed after Tuesday's mass evacuation of Barton House.

item.title: Heathrow passengers facing delays after staff shortages and strong winds
item.description: Limits on how many planes can take off have now been lifted, after a day of delays and cancellations.

item.title: League of Legends Worlds 2024 final to be held at London's O2 Arena
item.description: Multiplayer battler League of Legends reveals it will stage next year's grand final at the O2 Arena.

item.title: Imelda Mounfield, wife of Stone Roses bassist Mani, dies from cancer
item.description: Tributes are paid to Imelda Mounfield, who raised thousands for charity after her diagnosis.

item.title: Autumn Statement: Homes close to new pylons to get £1,000 off bills
item.description: The chancellor will unveil the plan, aimed at speeding up electricity upgrades, in his Autumn Statement.

item.title: Raac in schools: MPs demand answers over dangerous concrete
item.description: A "lack of basic information" from ministers is "shocking and disappointing", a report by MPs says.

item.title: Napoleon Bonaparte’s hat sells for €1.9m at Paris auction
item.description: The black bicorne felt hat was a trademark of the French emperor, and was sold above estimates.

item.title: Scotland 3-3 Norway: Steve Clarke's side head for Euro 2024 after closing draw
item.description: Scotland's successful Euro 2024 qualifying campaign ends with a draw as Mohamed Elyounoussi's late equaliser earns Norway a point at Hampden.

item.title: Cricket World Cup: Pat Cummins delivers again as Australia spoil India's party in Ahmedabad
item.description: Pat Cummins delivers again as captain and bowler in the World Cup final to place himself among Australia's greats after a golden six months.

item.title: Man Utd 1-3 Man City: Statement win as United recognise 'clear gap' in WSL
item.description: Manchester City knew there was no room for error when they turned up at Old Trafford to face rivals Manchester United with a Women's Super League title race hanging in the balance.

item.title: ATP Finals 2023 results: Novak Djokovic beats Jannik Sinner to win title
item.description: Novak Djokovic wins a record seventh ATP Finals title with a dominant victory over Jannik Sinner to cap "one of the best seasons" of his career.

item.title: Ugo Monye: Former England player alleges 'blatant racism' after Exeter Chiefs game
item.description: Premiership Rugby stands "united" with former England international Ugo Monye following allegations of racist abuse by a supporter at Exeter Chiefs' Sandy Park.

item.title: ICC Cricket World Cup: Watch the best shots from Travis Head's 'outstanding' 137
item.description: Watch the best shots from Travis Head's "outstanding" 137 for Australia against India in the Cricket World Cup final in Ahmedabad.

item.title: ICC Cricket World Cup highlights: Australia beat India to win their sixth Cricket World Cup
item.description: Watch highlights as Australia beat India by six-wickets in the Cricket World Cup final in Ahmedabad to claim their sixth World Cup title.

item.title: Israel hopeful of Hamas deal to release hostages in 'coming days'
item.description: It comes after Qatar's PM said "very minor" obstacles remained to a deal between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: Inside West Bank district under harsh Israeli lockdown since Hamas attack
item.description: In the fortified H2 area of Hebron, Palestinian residents are being forced off the street at gunpoint.

item.title: Israel-Gaza: Protests against MPs cross a line, says Rachel Reeves
item.description: The shadow chancellor says protesting outside the homes and offices of MPs is "intimidation".

item.title: Hamas hostages: Stories of the hostages taken by Hamas from Israel
item.description: From elderly grandparents to young children, these are the people known to have been taken captive.

item.title: Yemen's Houthi rebels hijack cargo ship in Red Sea
item.description: The Iran-backed rebels say the vessel is Israeli - a claim denied by Israel which blames Iran.

item.title: WHO says Gaza's al-Shifa hospital a death zone, as hundreds leave
item.description: The UN health agency examines al-Shifa after last week's raid by Israeli troops looking for a Hamas bunker.

item.title: Hospital evacuees flee Gaza City with tanks on street
item.description: Hundreds of Palestinians left al-Shifa hospital on Saturday and headed south on foot.

item.title: March reaches Jerusalem calling for release of Israeli hostages
item.description: Protesters walked from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem, before demonstrating at the Israeli prime minister's residence.

item.title: Israel orders Khan Younis evacuation in southern Gaza
item.description: The area hosts hundreds of thousands of people who had sought safety there after fleeing northern Gaza.

item.title: Biden facing growing internal dissent over Israel's Gaza campaign
item.description: It has stirred an extraordinary level of criticism from within the president’s own administration.

item.title: Bowen: Ceasefire demands will grow without proof of Hamas HQ at al-Shifa
item.description: Israel's rhetoric had suggested the Gaza City hospital was a nerve centre for the Hamas operation.

item.title: Tanzanian student taken hostage by Hamas confirmed dead
item.description: Clemence Felix Mtenga was an agriculture intern in Israel at the time of the Hamas attack.

item.title: Israel says it will allow two trucks of fuel a day into Gaza
item.description: Mobile phone and internet connections have reportedly been partially restored after a fuel delivery.

item.title: Netanyahu says Israel 'not successful' at minimising Gaza casualties but blames Hamas
item.description: Israel's PM says efforts to spare civilians "not successful", but says Hamas puts them in harm's way.

item.title: Labour MP Jo Stevens's office vandalised after Gaza vote
item.description: Police are investigating after a Labour MP who abstained on the Gaza vote had her office vandalised.

item.title: Autumn Statement 2023: When is it and how will it affect me?
item.description: Chancellor Jeremy Hunt is set to unveil the government's tax and spending plans.

item.title: Energy price cap: What is it and what will happen to bills in January?
item.description: The price cap which sets typical annual household energy bills is expected to rise slightly from January.

item.title: Cost-of-living payments: What are they, who gets them and are they fair?
item.description: Millions of low-income households are receiving the latest cost-of-living payment between by 19 November.

item.title: When should I turn the heating on?
item.description: As it gets colder here are some tips to help you stay warm while trying to keep your energy bills down.

item.title: Train strikes: What days in December will rail travel be disrupted?
item.description: Train drivers have announced further walk outs in a long-running dispute about pay and conditions.

item.title: What a falling inflation rate means for your finances
item.description: Falling inflation and rising wages ease cost of living pressures for some, but money is still very tight.

item.title: Fuel cost: How to save petrol and diesel
item.description: With weak competition adding to fuel prices, are drivers doing the right things to save money?

item.title: Energy bills: What can I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

item.title: UK inflation rate calculator: How much are prices rising for you?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: What is the UK inflation rate and how does it affect me?
item.description: The rate at which prices are rising has fallen but still remains above the 2% inflation target.
